definition: A document, originating from a vendor
note / comment: Alias vendor document schedule.

definition: The date at which the final revision of the document was actually issued
The unique identifier for the document according to the Owner/Operator document numbering scheme
The date at which the final revision of the document is expected to be issued
A description of what has changed in the vendor document since its previous document index transmission
A synonyms that uniquely identifies or represents a unit of measure
note / comment: This has been introduced as it is anticipated that not source standards may use e.g. the same symbol to represent the unit of measure. However a synonym should never point to two different units of measure.

definition: The unique name which designates the unit.
relationship verb: is also known or represented as

definition: The name by which a unit of measure can alternatively be designated
Indicates which unit of measure dimension codes are relevant for a unit of measure.
A unique identifier, assigned in the CFIHOS Reference Data Library (RDL) to the unit of measure dimension application.
A code that uniquely identifies the unit of measure dimension
relationship verb: dimension is used for multiple units of measurement

definition: A code that uniquely identifies the unit of measure dimension
A grouping of units of measure that relate to the same kind of quantity
note / comment: The term ''kind of quantity'' is defined and used in ISO 80000.

definition: A code that uniquely identifies the unit of measure dimension in CFIHOS
A code that uniquely identifies the unit of measure dimension
The name of the unit of measure dimension
A unit that qualifies the size of a quantity
A code that uniquely identifies the unit of measure in CFIHOS
A code that uniquely identifies the measurement system
A code that uniquely identifies the UNECE unit of measure
note / comment: The coding of units of measure will be based on UN/ECE codes. The reasons for this is that 1) ISO does not, in 2018, have codes for units of measure, and 2) UN/ECE is the standard used in EDI transactions, i.e. to exchange transaction information electronically between parties.

definition: A code that uniquely identifies the unit of measure dimension
The unique name which designates the unit.
The symbol used to represent the unit of measure based on the Energistics UoM standard
An exchange of information between two companies
The number of media provided with the transmittal
The project for which the transmittal has been issued
The reason for issuing the transmittal
note / comment: The reason for issuing a transmittal is independent of the statuses of the document revisions that the transmittal includes.

definition: The name of the company who has sent the transmittal
A unique transmittal identifier generated by the document control system of the company sending the transmittal
The date of sending the transmittal
A characteristic, or property, that a tag has
The plant where the tag will be installed
A code that uniquely identifies the process / activity
The process stream from on which the tag property value is based
A name that uniquely identifies the property

property name: reason for deviating from standard unit of measure
definition: The reason why the unit of measure as prescribed by the source standard as not been used to report the tag property value
The full name of a tag
note / comment: Different companies have different tag naming conventions. A tag name shall be unique within a plant.

definition: The total margin that has been applied on the value of the tag property, compared to what was evaluated as the process stream property
The value of the property for that tag
note / comment: The data type of that value must be aligned with the data type of the property. Moreover, if the property is numeric, it should be qualified by a unit of measure. If the property is not numeric, and has a pick list associated with the tag property value must be one of the entries in the set of pick list values.

definition: The unique name which designates the unit.
A physical connection between tags
note / comment: This information is primarily used for mechanical completions. For piping this information can be generated from 3D models. For electrical and instrumentation, this information can be generated from design tools. For pipes, the direction From To is the direction of the flow within the pipe. For electrical cables, the direction From To is the direction of the electrical current. For drivers (e.g., electrical motor), the From To is the direction of the flow of energy, consistent with ISO15926 and ISO22274. For an instrument having only one connection, the From is the Tag the instrument is mounted on (e.g., the vessel). For a valve, not causing a line break, the From is the line the valve is mounted on. For auxiliary equipment (e.g., a filter), the From is the Tag where the auxiliary equipment is mounted on.

definition: The plant the process unit is part of, and to which the originating tag belongs
The full name of a tag
The plant the process unit is part of, and to which the ending tag belongs
The full name of a tag
An alternate name used to designate a tag or equipment class
The full name of the tag or equipment class

property name: tag or equipment class synonym name

definition: A code used to designate the standard used to define requirements like engineering, operations, etc.

entity name: tag or equipment class property application condition

definition: An indication that the property is relevant for tags associated with the class
The name of the property that applies to a tag or equipment class
An indicator whether the property should be provided for a given equipment.
note / comment: It is important to distinguish the properties that should be provided by the EPC for an equipment, but e.g. not for a model. For instance, the colour of a car is relevant for a given instance of a car, but not for the model.

property name: property relevant for model / part indicator
definition: An indication whether the property must by provided by the EPC (or the manufacturer) for a given model.
note / comment: Some properties should be reported for the models / parts associated with an equipment class, some for the equipment associated with the equipment class. Those are two separate pieces of data.

definition: The SI (metric) unit of measure recommended for this tag or equipment class property.
relationship verb: Is the SI unit of measure name prescribed for

definition: The full name of the non abstract tag or equipment class to which the property applies

definition: A component of what makes a tag of equipment class

The component role within the parent system.
A group of properties that is allowed or authorised to be used for that purpose.

property name: tag or equipment class component is logical
definition: Indicates the component is a logical rather than physical component

definition: The maximum number of components for that tag or equipment class

property name: tag or equipment class component minimum number of components
definition: The minimum number of components for that tag or equipment class

property name: tag or equipment class component name
definition: The name of a smaller, self-contained part of a tag or equipment class.

property name: tag or equipment class component to be added indicator
definition: Indicates the component is to be added to the RDL

property name: tag or equipment class component typical number of components
definition: The typical, most frequently encountered number of components for that tag or equipment class
The full name of the tag or equipment class that is decomposed
A tag class or an equipment class
note / comment: A tag or equipment class can be at the same time a tag class and an equipment class. The two are not mutually exclusive.

definition: An indication whether the tag or equipment class is an aggregation of other tag or equipment classes and should not be used for associating properties
A unique identifier, assigned in the CFIHOS Reference Data Library (RDL) to the tag or equipment class
An indication that the tag or equipment class is considered as an equipment class

property name: parent tag or equipment class name

note / comment: The parent is actually mandatory for all classes, except the one at the top of the hierarchy.
relationship verb: parent class is specialised in child class

definition: An indication that the tag or equipment class is considered as a tag class
A definition of what the tag or equipment class is
example: Example : A panel containing full set of indicating devices and remote control units required for operation of a system or part of it

property name: tag or equipment class existence reason description
definition: An explanation of why the tag or equipment class was created / needed
note / comment: RDL management attribute, not shared contractually with contractors.
example: Example : Class requires maintenance during Operations.

definition: The full name of the tag or equipment class
A characteristic, or property, that a tag class has
The name of the property that applies to a tag or equipment class
The full name of the non abstract tag or equipment class to which the property applies
note / comment: The initial set of values will be the CFIHOS unique ids that were assigned to tag classes.

definition: An equipment class that can be used to implement the function of a tag class
note / comment: For example a Tag classified as a ''pump'' could have an equipment installed classified as a ''centrifugal pump'' or a ''rotary pump'' but it would not make sense to have a ''flow transmitter'' installed as this technology cannot satisfy the functional requirements of a pump.

definition: The full name of the tag or equipment class
The full name of the tag or equipment class

definition: An indication whether equipment are expected to be installed for tags that are associated with this tag class
The full name of the tag class
note / comment: The initial set of values will be the CFIHOS unique ids that were assigned to tag classes.

definition: An expression that represents the format of the tags belonging to the tag class
note / comment: This allows companies to have specific tag formats.

definition: An alternate name under which a tag may be designated
note / comment: These aliases are exchanged between the parties. Their origin may be historical, or alternate naming used by the different parties. But they should always have mapping to the official tag name.

definition: The plant where the tag is or will be located

definition: The construction assembly of a plant where the tag resides
note / comment: This should be a leaf node construction assembly.

definition: The corrosion loop that includes the tag
The company responsible for the design of the tag.

The unit that is in charge of maintaining the tag
A name used to uniquely identify the company who manufactures the model / part
A unique name to identify the model part of the manufacturer
An identification of the parentage of the tag
note / comment: The parent tag (also called main tag) can be a package, an instrument loop or an electrical circuit.

definition: The plant where the tag is or will be located

An indication whether the loss of the functionality provided by the tag would have an immediate cost impact, like a loss of production
The safety critical item group assigned to the tag, and identified according to International Standard
note / comment: This is only required if safety critical item indicator =Yes.

definition: An indication whether the tag should be considered as a safety critical element, as per International Standards.
note / comment: Safety Critical Elements (SCEs) are those elements of risk barriers, including equipment, hardware, and related control systems, for which :- the failure of which could lead to a major accident or event, or - that mitigate the consequences of a major accident or event. The basis for the selection of SCEs is the assessment of Major Accidents identified in each Asset HSE Case or those documents that support the Case.

definition: A documentation of the outcome of the SCE assessment
note / comment: This is only required if safety critical item indicator =Yes. It is populated according to International Standard.

definition: The full name of the tag or equipment class
note / comment: The initial set of values will be the CFIHOS unique ids that were assigned to tag classes.

definition: A functional description of the tag
note / comment: The description can also include the parent tag, where required. It should not include tag class, manufacturer and model information.
example: Example : ''Hot Oil Circulation Pump'' that clearly describes the function of the pump (the equipment assigned can be centrifugal or reciprocating pump). ''V 431 Separator Relief Valve'' that clearly describes the function of the valve, with additional parent related information.

definition: The full name of a tag
note / comment: Different companies have different tag naming conventions. A tag name shall be unique within a plant.

entity name: source standard document and data requirement
definition: A requirement for document or data, as expressed in a source standard, irrespective of the equipment class
note / comment: These Document and Data Requirements are of two kinds: 1) Design: Information generated during the design activity that has to be approved and reviewed by the purchaser. 2) Equipment: Information generated by the equipment manufacturer. This entity represents how to best manage this data, as all document and data requirements expressed in a standard are independent of the equipment classes the standard is covering. In the RDL, this table only contains the entries for document and data requirements as expressed in public standards. Owners / operators are expected to download them in their database, and then to complement that list with their own document and data requirements for their standards.

entity name: source standard document and data requirement
definition: A code that uniquely identifies the source standard document and data requirement in CFIHOS.

entity name: source standard document and data requirement

definition: The number of weeks that, by default, should be used by the vendor, vs the reference date, to provide documents containing this VDDR for final issue

definition: A code that uniquely identifies a document submission reference date
relationship verb: is the default reference used for sharing the information of

definition: An indication whether documents having for content this requirement shall be submitted by the vendor for review or not.

definition: The chapter of the engineering standard from which originates the VDDR

entity name: source standard document and data requirement
definition: A code used to designate the standard used to define requirements like engineering, operations, etc.

definition: A remark that the originator of the document and data requirement for this source standard wanted to capture

entity name: source standard document and data requirement
property name: source standard document and data requirement description
definition: A precise description, as documented in the engineering standard, of the VDDR in term of what the content of the document shall be
example: Example : The seal cross-sectional drawing shall include at least the following information:a) all seal components related to the order as well as pump components related to the seal.b) dimensions to properly verify the seal setting position.c) Pump dimensions interfacing with the seal.d) Seal boundary dimensions.e) Seal Chamber and gland-plate connection dimensions.f) Auxiliary system and utility specifications.g) Connecting dimensions for the auxiliary system and utilities.h) [...]

example: Example : Anticipated thermal movements for major connections

definition: A short description of the information deliverable that would typically include this document and data requirement
note / comment: This field uses CFIHOS naming as much as possible, and is aligned as much as possible with the JIP33 library of typical deliverable.

definition: A standard used to define requirements like engineering, operations, etc.

definition: A code used to designate the standard used to define requirements like engineering, operations, etc.

entity name: purchase order item vendor document and data requirement
definition: A vendor document and data requirement (VDDR) deemed to be appropriate jointly by the purchaser and the vendor for a given purchase order.
note / comment: The Purchaser specifies for each VDDR the dates at which the Vendor shall send the corresponding information to the purchaser (e.g. issue for review date).During the ITT process the Vendor shall review the PO_VDDR and confirm: - The relevance of the VDDR's requested with regard to the equipment being requisitioned. For packages, the Vendor shall take into account all ancillary equipment, e.g. on a pump package there may be pulsation dampers, which may be deemed to be pressure vessels.  -The ability to meet specified VDDR's submittal dates.Following review, the Vendor will make adjustments according to the ITT clarification process regarding the VDDR omissions. The Vendor shall sign the agreed PO_VDDR.After PO award, a revised requisition package will be submitted to the Vendor with a revised PO_VDDR. The Vendor shall sign the revised PO_VDDR.

definition: A user-readable set of data structured in order to be printed and stored as a whole (includes drawings)
note / comment: Disciplines specify the content of the documents delivered.The file provided (See FILE_NAME property) shall be:- The most used rendition (when than one rendition is given for the same document).- The entry point for the document (e.g., the table of content, when the document has been split into multiple files).Remark: - All files generated in PDF format shall be text-searchable with commenting enabled.- All files shall be fully virus checked by the Contractor before submission.

note / comment: One potential use is to allow Owner/Operator to identify duplicate documents provided by multiple subcontractors but from the same OEM.

definition: The name of the file as provided by the manufacturer
note / comment: Remark: One potential use is to allow Owner/Operator to identify duplicate documents provided by multiple subcontractors but from the same OEM. This document shall not contain any project specific cover page, but only the manufacturer cover page.

definition: The plant that the document revision is related to
note / comment: This is a very ''high level'' grouping of documents used to segregate documents dealing with different Plants. ''Low level'' document references shall also be provided for the Document (See ''Document References'').

definition: The code that identifies the project the document revision refers to
A code that uniquely identifies the stage of projects
An indication whether this document is to be developed to meet regulatory compliance requirements
An Indication of the media type used for storing the content. of the document revision
The transmittal through which this document revision was communicated
A type of review that is required for a document
A code that uniquely identifies a document review type
A description of what the document review type represents
example: Example : The review type is not specified.

definition: A status assigned to a document revision after review
A status assigned to a document revision after review
A description of what the document status represents
example: Example : Applicable to documents with Review Type ''review and approve''

definition: A classification of the documents according to how they should be represented
A code that uniquely identifies the document representation type
A description of what the document representation type is or represents
A placeholder that allows a project to identify a particular information content to be created or updated
note / comment: A document master is identified by a document number, and it groups all the document revisions created to mature the information content.An index of document masters is called a Master Document Register (MDR), and it allows a project to plan when the information content will reach a particular status (e.g., AFC, ASB). Remark: The first issuance of the document Master will be the baseline plan. Subsequent issuances will reflect any changes in forecast dates.

definition: At alternate way of identifying uniquely a combination of discipline and document type
note / comment: This attribute is calculated as a concatenation of the discipline code and the document type short code.

definition: The unique identifier for the document according to the Owner/Operator document numbering scheme
A code that uniquely identifies a document review type
A description, in a short and concise manner, of the content of the document
note / comment: The title of the document usually appears on the front page of the document or in title block.
example: Example : Laydown Area & Pipe Rack North / South

definition: The latest forecast date at which the document is expected to be issued for approval
note / comment: The first issuance of the Document_Master will be the baseline plan.

definition: The latest forecast date at which the document is expected to be issued approved for construction
note / comment: The first issuance of the Document_Master will be the baseline plan.

definition: The latest forecast date at which the document is expected to be issued approved for design
note / comment: The first issuance of the Document_Master will be the baseline plan.

definition: The latest forecast date at which the document is expected to be issued as-built
note / comment: The first issuance of the Document_Master will be the baseline plan.

definition: The latest forecast date at which the document is expected to be issued for review
note / comment: The first issuance of the Document_Master will be the baseline plan.

definition: A format, or package, that has to be used to provide a given type of document
A code that uniquely identifies a format that a document can take
A description of what the document format represents
A classification of the document and data requirements according to when / by whom the information is generated

property name: document and data requirement type code
definition: A code that uniquely identifies the type of document and data requirement

property name: document and data requirement type description
definition: A description of what the document and data requirement represents
example: Example : Information generated during the design activity that has to be approved and reviewed by the purchaser.

definition: A classification of the document and data requirements according to their nature
note / comment: This classification originates from JIP33.

property name: document and data requirement group code
definition: A code that uniquely identifies the group to which a vendor document and data requirement belongs

property name: document and data requirement group name
definition: A description of what that group of vendor document and data requirements represents
An indication of the status that a document type should have, if any, at a given handover event, for a given discipline
The discipline to which refers the discipline document type requirement
note / comment: The discipline / document type documented from the RDL could be overwritten by the Owner / Operator.

entity attribute name: required document status for the handover event
definition: The status that the document should have, as required for this discipline, this document type at this handover phase.
note / comment: A document is classified by a single state, which changes as the document advances through this lifecycle.

definition: The document type to which refers this discipline document type requirement
The event prior to which document types for a given discipline have to be handed over
An identification of what type of document is required for what discipline, and what are their delivery requirements
note / comment: Discipline document type is NOT a distribution list.

definition: The type of asset that is used as reference for the discipline document type
The format under which the authoritative record should be provided
note / comment: In the RDL, this information will be left blank. It is the responsibility of each owner / operator to specify the format under which the authenticated record should be provided.
relationship verb: is the authenticated record format required for

definition: A unique identifier, assigned in the CFIHOS Reference Data Library (RDL) to the discipline document type
The discipline a discipline document type refers to
note / comment: The discipline / document type documented from the RDL could be overwritten by the Owner / Operator.

definition: A comment about this discipline and document type
At alternate way of identifying uniquely a combination of discipline and document type
note / comment: This attribute is calculated as a concatenation of the discipline code and the document type short code.

definition: The type of review to be conducted for the documents classified with this document type and this discipline
The document type a discipline document type refers to
The representation type that should be used for documents of this type, for this discipline
An indicator which specifies if documents classified with this document type require a paper hardcopy. During project and/or after project
The format under which the native document should be provided
note / comment: In the RDL, this information will be left blank. It is the responsibility of each owner / operator to specify the format under which the native file should be provided.
relationship verb: is the native format required for

definition: An indication of whether the native file should be delivered during project / handover
An indicator which specifies if documents classified with this document type have to be translated in another language during project and/or after project
A branch of knowledge of expertise which is responsible for the content of the deliverable
A unique identifier, assigned in the CFIHOS Reference Data Library (RDL) to the discipline
A code that uniquely identifies a discipline.
note / comment: The discipline / document type documented from the RDL could be overwritten by the Owner / Operator.

definition: A description of what the discipline covers
example: Example : Health is the discipline concerned with protecting the health and welfare of people engaged in work or employment.

definition: The name by which the discipline is designated
A format required to be used by the supplier of information in conformance with JIP33 standard
A code that uniquely identifies the format of the deliverable
A description of what the deliverable format represents
A classification of data elements according to their nature
An indication what are the type of values a data element can take
A description of what the data type code represents
A classification of corrosion loops
A code that uniquely identifies the type of corrosion loop
The name by which the corrosion loop type is usually designated
A grouping of tags with similar operating conditions, e.g. pipe, equipment, .. (i.e., made of similar materials of construction, sharing similar corrosion/degradation rate)
note / comment: Corrosion Loops are created to monitor the corrosions of equipment and thus are important to establish proper inspection strategies.

definition: A code that uniquely identifies the corrosion loop at a plant
A description of what the corrosion loop is
example: Example : V301 separator vessel below demister. Condensate liquid outlet piping to BL.

definition: The name by which the corrosion loop is usually designated
A description of the process performed by the elements of the corrosion loop
example: Example : V301 separates the 15 barg gas stream into dry saturated gas and condensate containing hydrocarbons, free sour water (CO2 and H2S) and inhibitor.

definition: The type of corrosion loop that classifies this corrosion loop
A description of the expected effects of the corrosion
example: Example : Vessel is made of 15mm PWHT carbon steel including 3mm corrosion allowance.Normal operation Wet CO2 corrosion.Special operating conditions Un-inhibited the corrosion rate is 1.1mm/yr. Inhibiter injection should be monitored and alarmed.

definition: The plant at which the corrosion loop is located
Any item which is expendable, may be regularly replaced and generally is not product specific, for example oil, grease, nuts, bolts and screws, gaskets, etc.
note / comment: Definition inspired by IEC 62550 Spare parts provisioning.

definition: Position / Item number of the item on the Manufacturer's Equipment drawing.
The full name of the equipment class
A name used to uniquely identify the company who manufactures the model / part
A description of the main function of the model part.
A unique name to identify the model part of the manufacturer
The original model part manufacturer name if different.
The original model part manufacturer part number if different.
The shelf life of the model part.

entity attribute name: shelf life unit of measure name
definition: The unit of measure that uniquely identifies the shelf life duration.
A grouping of tags intended to be assembled and installed as a whole
note / comment: Tag modules are created to facilitate fabrication during the project.

definition: A code that uniquely identifies the construction assembly at a plant
A name describing the purpose of a construction assembly
A code that uniquely identifies the parent of a construction assembly at a plant
The plant at which the construction assembly is constructed
The role of the component of the Tag or Equipment Class
A unique identifier, assigned in the CFIHOS Reference Data Library (RDL) to the component role.
A description of the component role.
example: Example : An inlet is a tube, valve, or other part through which a fluid enters a device or machine.

definition: The component role within the parent system.
An operator that compares one expression with another
note / comment: The result of the comparison can be True, False, or Unknown. Comparison operators include the typical ones, recognised by all DBMSes, but also entries like ''IN'', to check if the left member of the comparison is present in a list of values, separated by semicolon, in the right member of the comparison.

definition: A code that uniquely identifies the comparison operator
The description of what the comparison operator represents
A legal entity engaged in business as a proprietorship, partnership, corporation, or other form
The first line of the address of the company
example: Example : 6, Water side Business Park Eastways

definition: The second line of the address of the company
The third line of the address of the company
The name of the person to contact in the company
A description of the role of the contact person within the organisation of the company
The official email address of the company
The official fax number of the company
A name used to uniquely identify the company
note / comment: It is sometimes extracted from maintenance management system. The owner / operator and the EPC company need to align on the name of companies.

definition: The official telephone number of the company
The country where the company address is located
An indicator whether the company is a manufacturer or not
An indicator whether the company is a supplier or not
A grouping of tags (if the commissioning unit is at the lowest level in the structure), or sub-commissioning units, by the commissioning discipline
note / comment: This grouping allows one to perform commissioning activities.

definition: A code that uniquely identifies the commissioning unit within a plant
The name by which the commission unit is usually designated
A code that uniquely identifies the parent of the commission unit at the plant
The plant the commissioning unit is part of
A system that has similarities to CFIHOS, and has been coding the objects relevant to CFIHOS in a different way
A description of what that coding source is
example: Example : A non-profit global-standardisation member organisation that shall promote the development of open specifications to be used as standards for enabling the interoperability of data, software and related matters.

definition: A code that uniquely identifies the system that has been assigning codes to objects relevant to CFIHOS
A code assigned by a coding source to a tag class
The code, assigned in the coding source, to the object that is equivalent to the CFIHOS object
A unique identifier, assigned in the CFIHOS Reference Data Library (RDL) to an object in the CFIHOS RDL
The system that has been assigning codes to objects relevant to CFIHOS
A classification of discipline document types according to the type of asset they refer to
A code that uniquely identifies the type of asset
A description of what the asset type represents
A geographical surface occupied by a Plant
note / comment: A plant area is created to identify the physical location of an equipment within a plant.

definition: A code that uniquely identifies the area within the plant
A name describing the location of an area within the plant
The plant the area is part of
An application condition that is used as a component, or member of an application condition group
A code that uniquely identifies an application condition that is member of the application condition group
A code that uniquely identifies a group of application conditions this is a member of
A grouping of application conditions, that have all to be satisfied to be able to say that the condition group is satisfied
note / comment: An application condition group returns a value true if all the application conditions associated with it are true. The same application condition group can be used for multiple mappings of tag or equipment classes to source standards.

definition: A code that uniquely identifies a group of application conditions
A description of what the application condition group represents
A condition under which some document or data requirements have to be applied
A code that uniquely identifies an application condition
A description of what the application condition represents
The value against which a property must be compared to know if the application condition is met
A code that uniquely identifies the application condition in CFIHOS.
A code that uniquely identifies the comparison operator
The name of the property the application condition refers to
The full name of the non abstract tag or equipment class to which the property applies
The unique name which designates the unit.
The unique identifier for the document according to the Owner/Operator document numbering scheme, to which the additional file is associated
relationship verb: is complemented by zero, one or more
CDF reverse property name: document master to file reverse relation
CDF reverse property description: the files related to a document

definition: A file that makes up a particular document revision.
note / comment: In some circumstances, a particular document revision can be made up of more than one file. Examples include:- Native files- Translations of a document- Large documents that have been split into several smaller files. When this is the case, all these files shall be provided as a ''set of files''.

definition: A code used to identify the content of a document at a certain point in time according to the Owner/Operator Document Revision Coding scheme
note / comment: It is used to track the evolution of a document during its lifecycle and is applied at time of release from Originator to reflect the document is frozen.
relationship verb: is complemented by zero, one or more

definition: The unique name of the electronic file (including its extension)
A description in a short and concise manner of the content of the additional file
note / comment: This is not meant to repeat the document title. The FILE_TITLE shall be unique within a particular document revision. Refer to the chapter Set of Files for more information.
example: Example : PEFS Crude Oil Booster Pumps (Native)

definition: The language in which is expressed the additional file
The type of media used to store the content of the additional file
